item.title: Code It Anyway You Want: Initializing Reference Type Static Fields Inline for Enhanced Code Readability
item.description: Microsoft advises initializing reference type static fields inline to enhance code readability and prevent issues from uninitialized fields. Two patterns are shown: inline initialization and using a static constructor. While both methods do not allocate memory, using a static constructor may slightly improve performance. EditorConfig can check for adherence to this guideline. Link to article: https://dotnettips.wordpress.com/2025/12/21/code-it-anyway-you-want-initializing-reference-type-static-fields-inline-for-enhanced-code-readability/
